findings.title: Latest version of solidity compiler is recommended
findings.description: It is recommended to use the latest version of the Solidity compiler.

findings.title: Accepting Zero Tokens in burn, transfer, and burnFrom Functions
findings.description: The burn, transfer, and burnFrom functions accept a value of 0 tokens, which is incorrect as it spends gas on a transaction that does not alter the state.

findings.title: transfer should return boolean true/false
findings.description: The transfer function does not follow the ERC20 specification by returning a boolean value indicating success or failure.

findings.title: Approval Event Not Following ERC20 Spec
findings.description: The Approval event is triggered when approve is called but does not follow the ERC20 specification.

findings.title: mintToken emits the Transfer event twice
findings.description: This can be simplified to `Transfer(0, target, mintedAmount);`

findings.title: Throwing Will Consume All Gas
findings.description: Consider returning in some cases to preserve the users gas

findings.title: Burn Function Doesn't Check Frozen Address
findings.description: The burn function doesn't check whether the address is frozen, therefore it is possible to 'melt' the frozen tokens and thereby decrease the total supply.

findings.title: mintToken isn't checking for overflows
findings.description: The mintToken function does not check for overflow when minting tokens.

findings.title: burnFrom never decreases allowance amount
findings.description: This would allow someone with an allowance to burn all tokens belonging to that token holder.

findings.title: burnFrom Access Control
findings.description: burnFrom function should only be callable by the contract owner otherwise anyone with an allowance can burn all tokens belonging to that token holder.
